prompt:
Describe the spatial relationships in this diagram.

CONTAINMENT: Which text labels are inside or outside each closed curve?
CONNECTIONS: Which text labels are connected by lines? Note any branching or unconnected lines.
BOUNDARY CROSSINGS: Do any lines cross the boundaries of closed curves?
NESTING: Are any closed curves nested inside others?

Do not interpret meaning. Only describe what you see spatially.
evaluation:
# Spatial Relationships in the Diagram

## CONTAINMENT:
- The text "Grounded" is inside a closed oval/elliptical curve
- The text "man" is outside the closed curve, positioned to the left of it

## CONNECTIONS:
- A horizontal line connects the text "man" to the oval boundary
- The line extends from the right side of "man" and terminates at the left edge of the oval
- There is no branching observed
- The text "Grounded" inside the oval is not connected by any lines

## BOUNDARY CROSSINGS:
- The horizontal line from "man" meets the oval boundary but does not cross through it
- The line terminates at the boundary edge

## NESTING:
- There is only one closed curve (the oval)
- No nested curves are present in the diagram
